inn1.comm: eesh, you cant have that with a scary fast bowler. Back of a length ball, left alone bounces on its way through to the keeper

so much for that. Dolly of a catch at cover and Kusal has to trudge off. Sucked into a flick because this was a fullish delivery angled in at him. But he has gone for the shot far too early. Leaps off the leading edge and settles snugly in the hands of Imad Wasim. Thats about as good as a bright and shiny welcome mat from the hosts to the visitors
good length ball outside off, check driven to mid-off
lots more flair in that. Saw red once the ball was given width and Dilshan flays it to point. MIght actually have hit that too hard for it to amount to anything
looks for the yorker early, Dilshan watches it carefully and jams an open face down wide outside off to get himself and the team off the mark
thats the favour returned. Irfan pops up a full toss to the nervous new batsman who calmly clips it to long leg to get off the mark.
defends under his eyes, but he did look a little gingerly doing so. Not much footwork, just put the bat in line of a shortish delivery on off stump and gets an inside edge behind square leg
good length ball on and around off stump, defended
thats sweet. All mid-on can do is fetch that back. It wasnt overpitched, but Dilshan is a lovely driver of the ball. Gets his weight into the shot and punches with a pristine, straight bat

a little bit of an encore that! Anwar looks to keep the ball full, but his search for swing is in vain. Dilshan simple steps forward and drives through the line of a ball outside off. Beats cover and this outfield is rapid
immediately pulls his length back and Dilshan watches it sail past his off sutmp
not enough room for the cut, which means he hits it straight at point.
135 kph, slants the ball into the left-hander a little too acutely. Thirimanne attempts another leg glance, doesnt hit it

hint of shape away outside off brings about a little indecision in the batsman. Pace is up too at 140 kph. Irfan likes that, presents a big smile as Thirimanne was looking to poke outside off and only just about retrains himself
just shortish on off stump, defended

big bounce from the big man, but Thirimanne has played this so well. He has been camping on the back foot so far, and this is short enough for that. Swivels nicely and just helps the ball to the long leg boundary
looks to pin him on the thighs again, Thirimanne protects himself from that hurt (and just possibly, possibly to get a few runs) by flicking to midiwcket
nice and full on off stump at 145 kph, protects his castle with a big wooden plank like thing that people call bat these days
looks for the drive, but it hits more of an inside edge and dribbles to mid-on. Irfan is mixing his lengths nicely here, that one was full again
good start. Looks for off stump with a back of a length delivery and gets a circumspect Dilshan defensive shot

swubg fir Rahat! Traps Dilshan on the pad as he was falling away. But the inward movement might have been a touch too much. Appeal from the bowler, but the good length ball pitched outside leg and hit outside leg as well

loooovely! He is getting the ball to move just enough to put some doubts in the batsman. Dilshan thought this back of a length deliveyr will just go one with the angle. Then realises it hit the deck and comes back in. Looks to play, but decides to leave on the bounce. Phew
short and wide, Dilshan sets up for the cut as he should have. But the ball just doesnt bounce
worked away off his thigh pad, long leg will mop up.
mild appeal from the bowler and the keeper to try and throw the umpire off. But no such luck. Umpire Tucker has spotted the wide down the leg side. Thirimanne had played and missed a flick.

looks like he was reaching for that. Batsmen need to be greedy like that when the ball is so poor. Too short, too much width, crashed through point. Started the over so well, but then the last couple of balls havent been as good
teasing angle acorss the right-hander, which Dilshan negotiates with a half-step forward and a push to cover
invites the drive, gets the drive, gets a four. Dilshan has found his feet quite early in the innings. Big backlift comes down strongly on an overpitched delivery. Banished to long-off
full and tailing in late, Dilshan does well not to fall over - like last time - and flicks through midwicket
shortish and into the left-handers body, nudged away to long leg
quick, short and right on middle. Dilshan goes for the pull, but it looks like he is a little hurried. Mistimes the shot through square leg
good length ball at 145 kph on middle and leg, safely defended
that time he is way too early on the pull and ends up toe-ending the shot through midwicket. Looks like Pakistan do not want to give Dilshan the fuller length. Short ball again...
some cut back in off the deck, not particularly threatening for Dilshan who looks in good touch. Worked into the midwicket region and he runs with the shot
pushes the left-hander back with a shorter ball on middle as well. Defends it carefully, and then practices a pull. Good that Thirimanne is being calm enough to take his time

slips in the fuller ball here and it puts Thirimanne in a little tangle. That in duck he is getting works well in his favour as it pitches outside off and cuts back at the left-hander. Thirimanne defends with his hand well in front of the body
short of a good length, slid down the leg side as the batsman misses the flick
offcutter well wide of off stump, Sarfraz gets a bad bounce and Sri Lanka capitalise off the misfield
shortish and outside off, but it isnt wide enough for the cut. Dilshan disagrees, and gets an inside edge for his trouble
there is no one on the leg side besides mid-on, and this shortish delivery on the pads is deftly worked away to deep square leg
dug in quite short, at 136 kph, Thirimanne has spotted the change in length early and ducks under it
138kph, gets onto his front foot against a good length ball and works it to midwicket
he is talking to himself, geeing himslef up as Irfan thunders in. Its a short ball wide outside off, tapped away behind point
gets across to the nudge into the leg side and prevents the batsman from thinking of a quick single. Did well there Irfan
full and on the pads, whipped away to long leg

think he held that one back just enough to suck the batsman into a false shot. Yes, Dilshan says that was the offcutter. Teasing length and line just outside off and the batsman drives on the up as he was tempted to. Rizwan dives to his right at short cover, but he had no chance
thats an excellent delivery. Thirimanne made it look better by remaining pinned to his crease. Back of a length delivery angled in, hits the deck and seams away past the poking bat
good length ball outside off, pushed to cover
good length ball, which does come back in, tucked to short midwicket. Offcutter again.
flows into an extra cover drive, but Yasir chases it down. Fuller ball, with enough width, and Thirimanne does quite well to lean into that shot. Didnt look to hit it hard at all
some curl back in off the deck, Dilshan ensures he plays it late and with the direction the ball is headed. Finds a single to long leg
full and angled across at 130 kph, Thirimanne refuses to play a shot
gets some shape away but it happens after the good length ball was left quite alone outside off
fuller delivery on off stump, pushed smartly to mid-off. Looks like he is getting a bit more confident of his front foot
looks like the cutter, which he has picked, and dabs to third man on the boundary. Lovely little late cut
another slower ball just outside off, Dilshan judges it well and defends to short cover

the outside edge, not often has that happened this afternoon with Dilshan. Gets a good length ball to straighten and foil Dilshans attempt to hit through the line. The ball, instead of skipping away through cover, ends up flying down to third man
125 kph, cant be short at that pace, even if it was the intended slower ball bouncer. Easily pulled to deep midwicket
gets up tall behind a short delivery outside off and punches to point, who is quite agile. Shehzad dives to his right  and controls it well. Thirimanne is gutted he didnt pick the gap
fuller off cutter way down the off side, left quite alone. Perhaps he was looking for a wide, but it was just inside the tram line

loses his patience and goes for the cut! Lucky not to edge it. Admonishes himself as he walks away. Just enough movement away from the bat from Rahat, and it might have kicked up off the deck just enough too
a loose, uppish drive which wanders away to third man. Good length ball and it is on and around the sixth stump - the danger zone for him
full on off stump, drilled to mid-on
gets a toe end to a fuller ball outside off and finds cover
looks to ride the line of the ball just outside off and pick a quick single to point. Shehzad is extremely alert there. Very switched on
full and wide outside off, Thirimanne collects a wide as the bowler looks ruefully back. He has no reason to complain though
leans back and drills the short ball to the left of point, Shehzad is a little sluggish this time and dives too early. That is the fifty partnership for this pair
waits on the good length slower ball and slices it behind point. Adjusted nicely to the lack of pace, he had sized up the length and was looking to drum a big drive through
beaten outside off. Its just the angle it would seem, as Anwar gets the back of a length ball to wobble away. Thats what hes been doing all day. His seam has rarely come down upright

theres the slower ball again, Thirimanne was moving across to try and flick. Misses, the ball wanders down leg and the ump calls wide. But Sarfraz behind the stumps is miffed. He thought it brushed the batsman
fuller delivery outside off, eased to the left of point for an easy single
starts off a shade short and it turns past his pads. Flicked to long leg
short again, and Dilshan backs away to cut to deep point.
tossed up on off stump, gets a little drift in doing so. Thirimanne is forward with a dead bat
quick and flat on middle and leg, Thirimanne works it away between square leg and midwicket
stays back considering Yasir keeps bowling flat and short and outside off. Cut away strongly to deep third man
down the track, and gets too close to this loopy delivery on middle and leg. Drilled past the short midwicket diving to his right
back of a length on off stump, Thirimanne gets across and works it through midwicket
short and outside off, Dilshan gets up off his toes and taps the ball through point
116kph, fuller delivery outside off, driven into the covers
big dive to his left from Shehzad as he stops a backfoot punch from going any further. Still, slower ball bowling
too much width that time and the batsman camps back and hammers it away to the right of point. Vicious hit
full on off stump, dabbed to mid-on
loops the ball up outside off, Dilshan lunges forward, across and is down on one knee to lap sweep

thunders down the track, but Yasirs turn beats him. Was looking to open up the leg side as he charged outside off. Cant get to the pitch, the ball turns right across his flick to thud into his front pad
good length ball on and around off stump, defended towards square leg
works the good length ball away through square leg
waits on a shortish delivery and cuts to point. As hard as he managed to hit that, he just couldnt place it well enough
starts with a loopy full toss just outside off, driven through the covers for a quick couple of runs
stays back to a good length ball and turns it to short midwicket
flighted on middle, tucked to square leg
gets a little drift away from the bat, which Thirimanne negotiates with the open face. Single to short third man
stays back to a fuller ball and slices it through to the sweeper
misses a drive off a very full delivery just outside off. Almost ended up as a yorker and Thirimanne didnt quite realise it. Thats drinks, by the way
waits on this flatter ball outside off to turn and then drives off the back foot, with an open face through cover
encouragingly tossed up on middle, Thirimanne defends around the corner
beaten in the flight as he runs down the track. That time there was no flight on offer because Yasir adjusted well. Pushed to mid-on
the intent from the last ball has created an opportunity nonetheless. This is a short ball down leg, pulled to long leg
drifts in on leg stump, but it is a low full toss as well. Clipped away through midwicket

ooh, inside edge as he comes down the track looking for a flick. Turns just enough to make him mistime his shots. But its the length that Thirimanne is not reading well enough. Looking to do too many things against Yasir
calmly defended through the covers for a single
slower through the air on middle. Thats why the push through to mid-off is a big aerial. Nowhere near being a chance though with Thirimanne having checked his shot just in time
low full toss on middle and leg, worked to long-on
fuller delivery on middle, defended with an open face for a single to point on the edge of the circle
tossed up and drifted in on middle, Dilshan whips it away to the left of long leg
thats better. Decides to vent on the part-timer, does so cleverly as well. Mid-off was up and this was overpitched on the stumps. So he moves beside the ball and lifts it down the ground
pushed through on middle and leg, goes on with the arm as well. Dilshan gets an inside edge as he defends
flighted in on middle and leg, Dilshan gets inside the line of the ball and drives through to deep point
stays back to a good length ball and flicks it. Square leg ends up diving over the ball after he moves to his left
good length ball on middle, smeared away through the covers off the back foot
stays back to a length ball on leg stump and defends with an open face. Single as the ball trickles to point region

beautifully done from Sri Lanka. They have decided not to take any risks with Yasir. But then again they arent letting him have his way. A beautifully flighted delivery is deftly put in front of cover for a quick single
full on leg stump, driven smartly, even if it was a little late, to long-off
tossed up on middle and leg, eased down through the leg side for another single. Yasir is concerned enough with this lack of dot balls to come talk to his bowler again
punched down the ground as he prefers staying leg side of the fuller ball on off stump
tossed up well wide of off stump, Thirimanne gets low for a late cut but finds short third man
fired in flat and onto leg stump, worked to short midwicket
flighted delivery outside off, shovel driven through point
squared up by a back of a length delivery that straightens at the final moment. It doesnt end up being threatening though because the ball has gone softer. Outside edge to third man

waft outside off, Dilshan has a wry smile as he is beaten. Slip in play there. Ohhh, but scarily, Umpire Rod Tucker has given an unofficial word to the captain that Irfan was straying onto the danger area
short ball outside off, slapped to deep point
nearly hits the blockhole at 139 kph, defended carefully
slower ball, and its off a fuller length. Thirimanne is forward with half a bat as he runs it down to third man
around the wicket to Dilshan as he pops up a short ball, Dilshan pulls strongly to deep square leg
tossed up just outside off, Dilshan crunches it to cover
a shade short, Dilshan is back in his crease to push to short cover
tossed up on middle and leg, driven back to the bowler
flighted on leg stump at 78kph, nudged past his pads through midwicket
width outside off and Thirimanne has swished at the ball and placed it well to the left of Mohammad Irfan at short third man. Might have sensed a boundary, but the fielder manages to catch up with it
flighted outside off, driven through the covers
a little extra bounce just outside off forces Thirimanne off his feet. Well played in the end as he defuses the short ball outside off towards point
gets inside the line of this short ball and works it through midwicket
moves around the wicket and digs in a cross-seamer short ball. Dilshan pulls and misses
full and outside off, sweetly pierces the gap at cover for a couple of runs. Hes driven really well this innings

44th half-century for Dilshan, and he is closing in on 10000 runs in ODIs as well. Soaks in the applause after he leans into a fuller delivery outside off and opens the face for an easy single to third man
short and wide outside off, Thirimanne gets up on tiptoe to dab the ball to the sweeper
flighted outside off, eased through the covers for another couple of runs. Thats Thirimannes half-century, second in as many matches. He likes batting in ODIs, doesnt he?
good length ball outside off, punched to long-on

sneaks through him! Its the arm ball, pitched a shade short of a length. Dilshan things it is an opportunity to cut. Realises there is no room, so he tries to adjust his stroke and use a straighter bat. But he is not quick enough in getting it down. Stayed low too, which might have been the major cause for his dismissal. End of a very good innings from the veteran, but he wouldnt like that it ended too early
flighted on middle, driven down the ground and Imad gets across to his left to stop it
tossed up on middle and leg, nudged to the left of short fine
tossed up on off stump, driven to long-on
flighted from around the wicket onto middle stump, Thirimanne blocks
pushes forward, then gets back as the ball is on a good length, worked away through square leg
nips down the track and taps a flighted delivery back to the bowler. Malik bowling around to the right-hander too
worked away to short midwicket
down the track with a nudge against a flighted delivery outside off. Short midwicket dives to his left
gets the ball to dip and pitch before Mathews can connect with the flick. Didnt step far enough forward. Wears it on the front pad
tossed up outside off, defended

slower through the air and outside off, Thirimanne is waiting on his front foot as he glides it to the left of short third man. Mathews calls for the single, and makes it in the absence of a direct hit
fuller delivery outside off, driven to long-off

shortish and outside off, Thirimanne backs away and plays a delicate little late cut. It has just enough on it to carry through to the boundary. Although Malik is the culprit there. Didnt bend down enough as he tried to flick the ball back at the edge of the rope
tossed up outside off, driven calmy through cover
good length ball just outside off, Mathews knocks it down in front of cover and sets off
oooh, beaten on the angle. Swishes outside off hoping the ball was going to turn. But Malik, bowling from around the wicket, just drifts it across with the arm
down the track, worked away through midwicket
stays back to another fuller delivery, almost lost his off stump. But the open face of the bat gets down in time
flighted on off stump, driven back at the bowler
shortish and outside off, patted into the covers off the back foot
tossed up on middle and leg, driven to long-on
keeps to his crease and slice a shortish ball outside off to deep point
flighted on middle and leg, worked to short midwicket
flatter, fuller and faster outside off. Mathews was going for a cut, and gets a bottom edge for bringing the bat down a shade too late
tossed up on middle, worked to short midwicket
good length ball outside off, driven to long-off
good length ball on middle, stays back and uses half a bat to secure a single through cover
flighted in on off stump, Thirimanne comes forward to defend. Sharp Pakistan fielding ensures theres no singles on offer
so he has to step out of his crease, get to the pitch and nudge the ball through midwicket
goes back and leaps outside off to take a length ball and drops it at midwicket
flighted on middle and leg, nudged through midwicket
pushed through on a length, Thirimanne is back to push the ball on middle stump through to long-on
tossed up on leg stump, from around the wicket, Angelo works it to short midwicket

big appeal from Malik, but I wonder if there was an inside edge. Bowling around the wicket to hit a good length and turn into the batsman. Tucks him up, but the appeal is no use because of the deflection off the bat
nudged into the leg side
stays back and slices a good length ball through to deep point
waits on the back foot and cuts the ball through point. Shehzad ran behind the ball, but didnt dive
good length ball outside off, pushed to long-off
in the air for a bit, but it was well wide of the short midwicket fielder. The back foot punch connecting a bit too early. looks like Wasim know how to vary his pace surreptitiously
down the track and flicks the flighted delivery to the right of deep square leg. Well enough that there is two on offer despite Anwars threat on the boundary
Anwar in the fray again, having to run a way to his right. Thirimanne tucked the ball soft enough, and wide enough to get a couple again
down the track to flick a good length ball down to long-on
tossed up on leg stump, tickled around the corner to short fine leg
flighted on the pads, worked away through to deep midwicket
down the track for a flick, theres two again to deep square leg. Good, soft hands to ensure Yasir has too long a distance to cover running forward
Rizwan runs across to his left from short cover, dives and stops a drive from passing through
takes the outside edge as Thirimanne looks to drive with an open face. Made him reach a bit further than the batsman would have liked, did Rahat with a good length ball
fullish on off stump, tapped to mid-on

theres the problem with pulling the trigger too early. Mathews is livid with himself. Ran down the track to an offcutter and toe-ends the strike straight to mid-off. Very soft dismissal for a batsman of his caliber.
short and wide, slashed to the deep cover fielder
fuller and outside off, Thirimanne goes for a drive on the up and gets it off the inside edge. Mid-on comes in handy
good length ball on off stump, Chandimal taps it in front of cover, benefits from a misfield and ends up getting two for his trouble
flighted in on leg stump, Chandimal looks to pierce the gap to the left of cover. Rizwan or Malik, cant quite see dives and doesnt allow it
stays back and pushes a length ball back at the bowler
flighted outside off, driven sweetly through the covers
strays down leg and whips a good length ball to long leg. Only a single with Anwar Ali down there
doesnt turn, as Chandimal stays back and flicks it to midwicket
moves leg side of the ball and uses the pace on offer to collect a single to deep third man. A shade too short there
slower, good length ball on the pads, Chandimal nudges it to long leg and drags his partner across for a couple again
goes back and knocks a shortish ball off his side into the leg side
full and on off stump, Thirimanne runs it to third man on the boundary
goes short, Chandimal swivels on his back foot and plays the pull down and to deep square leg
beautiful drive down the ground, but it is just a touch too straight. Forces the non-striker to fling himself back into his crease as the bowler plants a big ol boot down on it. Might be drinks
stays back and cuts a good length ball through to deep point. Just enough width to enable the stroke
lets the good length ball come on outside off and plants the bat down at the very last minute. Late cut to short third man
stands up tall and punches a flatter delivery to long-on
tossed up on leg stump, nudged around the corner for a quick single to square leg
flighted on middle, Chandimal is forward with soft hands and picks up a single through the covers
tossed up and drifting away from the bat, which is why Thirimanne is nervous getting forward. Defends outside the line and gets an inside edge as the ball turns
no sighters for Chandimal as he charges the new bowler straight away. Drives past Wasims left
stays back and pushes a good length ball on middle to long-on
nimble footwork gets him close to the ball, perhaps a little too close, taps it back to the bowler
down the track again to drive a flighted delivery on off stump back at the bowler
pushed through on leg stump, Chandimal stays put in his crease this time and helps himself to a single to square leg
stays back on middle and clips to midwicket
full on off stump, pushed into the covers
bowls around the wicket, for a length ball, and its skewed high into the air! Mid-off and mid-on are racing after it, but it falls safely. At least he was looking down the ground
uses the angle from around the wicket, uses Irfans pace as well and flicks a length ball on middle to the square leg boundary. No prizes for guessing what the message was then
fullish on off stump, Chandimal defends with soft hands and an open face for a single to point
full with a bit of room outside off, Thirimanne drives through the covers

thats mistimed! Thats a catch. Thats well taken! Chandimal was looking for that pick up shot over square leg again, but this time its a slower ball. The lack of pace dupes him. Hits the bottom of the bat, his bottom hand had flown off the bat. Clearly not in control of the shot and Yasir at long leg takes a very good, high catch
steps down the track to block a good length ball. Playing for nonexiistent turn there
flighted on leg stump, worked away to square leg
shortish and outside off, cut to the right of point where the fielder runs across and flings out a good hand to stop the ball
flighted on off stump, driven to long-on
good length, going on with the arm towards middle and off as Imad bowls around the wicket. Thirimanne goes back and finds a single towards point with the open face
struck right in line on middle, but Priyanjan was quite a way down the track. Flicking outside the line of the ball again as he hopes for it to turn
looks for the yorker, almost finds it, whipped to midwicket
length ball outside off, slapped to point
145kph, goes short and it slides down leg, Thirimanne swivels on his back foot and pulls to long leg
thats a quick, short ball which Priyanjan was not at all in control of. Goes for a pull, off the front foot, too late with the shot. The ball hits the  gloves and pops back down the pitch
bangede in short and slid across the right-hander. Priyanjan goes for an awful pull again, beaten
shortish and lifting up towards his ribs, Priyanjan is much better this time as he gets inside the line and nudges it to long leg
nips down the track and whips a good length ball from outside off stump to deep midwicket. Neat connection, but that was still risky
gets down the track and pops a low full toss back down the pitch
flighted on middle, eased into the covers
flighted on off stump, driven down the ground to long-off
beaten by the lack of flighted as he steps down the track. Defended into the off side
on the pads, Thirimanne clips it to the right of short fine leg
turn, bounce and even Thirimanne is troubled. He was backing away, Yasir followed him, the ball pitched just under his eyes and then leaps up to hit him on the thighs

taken? Taken says Shehzad. The umps are going for a second opinion, but the soft signal is not out. This was tossed up on middle, Thirimanne goes for a big slog sweep, didnt hit it cleanly. Shehzad ran forward, dives catches it well enough but it pops out if his hand - clear evidence of that - dribbles along the turf and even hits his chin! Then nestles back in the crook of his elbow and it claims it. Shouldnt have done that, really
tossed up and drifting into the pads, nudged away to short fine leg
flighted outside off, driven to long-on
flighted outside off, swept past short fine leg
steps down the pitch and defends outside the line. Gets struck on his front pad
strays on the pad, Thirimanne tickles it around the corner. Irfan is at short fine leg, he runs past the ball and waits for it to catch up with him. Easy two
sees the batsman charging, slows it up and pulls his length back. Thirimanne adjusts and plays a weird defensive shot
runs down the track and swings across the line of a fuller delivery outside off to midwicket
nudged away off the pads through square leg
good length ball outside off, clipped through midwicket
short of a length ball outside off, sliced behind point

that was clean! Shehzad into the act again, top effort this time. Into the slog sweep again, and this time he does connect quite well. Hits it high, hits it behind square. Shehzhad has to run to his left, dive as well and is horizontal with the ground as he pouches it. This time he makes sure the ball doesnt pop out by awkwardly smothering it against his chest
shortish and outside off, punched away through to the sweeper
defends inside the line after allowing the good length ball to turn. Should have been a lot more forward
goes for a sweep against a flighted delivery outside off. Laps it fine, calls for two and makes it clean

down the track, gets under the ball and lifts it over mid-off. Sweetly struck. Sri Lanka are still looking to attack, but that time the batsman was playing sensibly. And not just hitting out for the sake of hitting out
stays low! It was pushed through just outside off, Siriwardaa was going for a pull and ends up edging it
shortish and outside off, dabbed to deep third man

straying in line and Siriwardena makes him pay for it. Another clever cricket shot as he simply flicks the ball away, and ensures it is well to the left of Irfan, who was only looking to get a boot on the ball.
full and wide outside off, slashed away to deep point
short and wide, Priyanjan has nailed a cut. Absolutely nailed it, but there is protection in the  deep
full on off stump, Siriwardena defends

picks up a short ball and sends it sailing over deep midwicket! What a strike. Barely seemed like he put anything into the stroke, but there was absolutely no doubt that the ball would clear the ropes
oh, he has such a great knack of beating batsmen in the flight. Even those charging at him. Ensures Priyanjan cant get under it and he has to only defend
leans forward and whips towards long-on, Rizwan hurtles in from the boundary and almost injures himself because he overbalances

loud appeal as he sneaks in a straighter, flatter ball on middle and leg. Priyanjan was down the track, looking to nudge it around the corner. Struck in front, but he had come down too far. Hawk Eye suggests it would crash into middle though
worked away through the midwicket region, big vacant spots there and the bowler has to run after it himself
runs down the track, winds up and whips the flighted delivery away. Bisects deep midwicket and long-on
goes short and Siriwardena gets under the ball, collects the wide as well. Boy, he looks a very clever batsman
another short ball, but it doesnt rise as much. Pulls, and mistimes it, through midwicket
full and down the leg side, whipped away to deep square leg

taken! Rizwan, you beauty. Its a fuller delivery outside off, Siriwardena was looking to drive on the up and gets a thick outside edge. It is on its way down, but Rizwan keeps his eyes on it, dives low and takes a very good catch
offcutter to start, Pathirana defends his off stump
smeared through the covers! But Shehzad on the boundary does well, racing quite a long way to his left, then he moves around the ball, dives and flicks it back
short and wide outside off, slapped away to deep third man
gets down the track and whips a good length ball through to deep midwicket
flighted on middle and leg, nudged off his pads for a couple to long leg
goes for a big sweep, but he has missed it altogether. The ball deflects off his pad, clips the back of the pad and goes to third man
good length ball on middle, nudged through midwicket

inside out and over cover. Long-off, Rizwan, does his best but this has been extremely well placed. Ran down the track, reached the pitch and in doing so he had also made sure to give himself enough room to free the arms
good length ball, flatter as well, clipped through midwicket

oh, thats about seven degrees of awkward. Its the seven foot Irfan, who was wondering about diving forward to try and take a catch, Instead he decides to stay back and field. His body is somwhere, the ball was going finer. He sticks his hand out and ifnally saves runs at short fine leg. Pathiranas hopes of getting an easy boundary with a pull against a short ball down leg doesnt hapen
fuller and outside off, pushed down the ground

looks to clear the covers, only ends up offering a dolly to Hafeez at cover. The cross-seamer, at a fuller length and outside off. Priyanjan clears the front leg and goes for a slash. Gets it off the bottom of the bat and has to walk off
digs it in short, Malinga doesnt want anything to do with it. Too high of a bouncer there
offcutter outside off, Malinga pokes and misses. Sarfraz doesnt collect it cleanly because the ball pitches just in front of him. Pathirana is wise to the opportunity for a quick single
good length ball on middle, defended into the covers for a single again
shortish and outside off, looks to slash outside off, misses
full and outside off, gets down low and slices off the open face to deep third man. Only a single though

dropped by Rizwan. Its a short ball, Malinga moves his front leg away and goes for a wild pull. Only skews it straight off the splice. Midwicket runs across towards square leg, settles under it and it just pops out

reviewed! Sarfraz claims a catch down the leg side, the umpire Tucker gives it a wide. But there was a deflection here. Healthy sound too. Im inclined to think this is off the bat. Pathirana was looking for a flick as Irfan bowls full and down leg. Seems like he has feathered one down leg. No Hot Spot or Snicko. Its down to a judgment call. Oooh, but it has been called not out. Its the old no conclusive evidence to overrule the on-field call
full on middle, pushed down the ground towards long-on
its short, he makes his own room by kicking that front leg aside and then belts a pull past short midwicket. That wakes Colombo up
hammered through extra! Again, he dismisses his front leg, camps on his back leg and wallops a back of a length ball on leg stump through the off side
that time the bounce is a bit too much for the Malinga pull. Good, fast short ball soars over the batsman

a direct hit now! Pakistan on fire! This was back of a length and cramping Pathirana up. The ball was knocked down somehwere at short midwicket. Anwar runs across, gets down, turns around, takes aim and nails the bowlers end stumps. Pathirana had just given up. He knew he had no chance it if hits
a slower short ball, Malinga picks it up and mauls it over the midwicket boundary. Poor bowling from Anwar. Where are the toecrushers to the tailender?
there it is. Looks for the yorker, ends up a low full toss on middle and leg. Malinga doesnt want to stay in line with the ball and gets an inside edge onto pad
low full toss outside off, tonked away to long-on. Thats Sri Lankas 250
hits the yorker on middle, Lakmal gets a quick single to mid-off
perfect yorker on middle, Malinga can only get a single to long-on
lobs up a full toss outside off, from around the wicket, Malinga was looking to slash it away. Does not make the tiniest connection. Looks for a no-ball, but the square leg ump shakes his head
backs away, but Irfan bowls it full and wide outside off. Malinga cant reach it
simple catch to Rizwan at midwicket. Its short, it was cramping Malinga for room even though he was moving away down leg. Tries to swat the ball away, but only manages to find the fielder
full and wide outside off, Pradeep swings wildly and well inside the line
that should be a no-ball. Pretty high full toss, that the batsman tries to cut away. No connection, but they do sneak a quick bye and then Lakmal will be on strike for the free hit
goes for the yorker, Lakmal swings away. Middle stump is knocked back. Free hit ball, remember

runs away outside off to try and lap the ball away to deep fine leg. Doenst connect. The non-striker has set off, the batsman is wondering what to do. Sarfraz misses the stumps at his end, the ball is taken by Irfan so Pradeep suddenly has to run back. A big overarm throw misses as well and Sri Lanka end up with two byes! Oh, how fun

inn2.comm: predictably full and straight to start, Azhar is forward with a crisp flick wide of long-on
good length ball with a hint of shape away after pitching, Shehzad covers his off stump and leaves outside it
misfield, allows him to get off the duck. Looks for a the push into the covers, gets it off the toe and puts gully in the firing line. Seems like the ball had hit the tips of his fingers
back of a length and outside off, Azhar waits on it, plays close to the body and taps the ball through the covers
squares him up with a back of a length delivery nipping away. Defended well enough though
calling the big booming drive outside off, wrong number says Malinga. Fuller ball leaves him groping outside off
back of a length and outside off, not bothered with

walks down the pitch, meets the shortish delivery with soft hands and finds a single to mid-on. Fielder doesnt pick the ball up, Pradeep the culprit. Concentrating on the throw instead of controlling the ball
short of a length and outside off, defended
keeps back and blocks a shortish delivery just outside off
gets forward to a good length ball and punches it through the covers

strays on the pads, Azhar gets inside the line and picks it away towards the long leg boundary. Malinga patrols that region, runs to his right, goes for the dive but ends up parrying the ball onto the ropes
beats short cover on his right, but Mathews manages to catch up with it by the extra cover boundary. Drills the good length ball and more importantly picks the gap
to his left this time. Kusal at short cover is getting quite a work out. Might have got into the back foot push a little early, but he adjusts well enough and places it wide of the fielder
no chance for long leg. Its a short ball, which the batsman gets across to and helps it on its way. Precisely played pull. No intention to hit it hard either
shuffles outside off, sliced past the short point or maybe gully fielder
width outside off, Shehzad climbs into it. Gets forward and slaps the ball away past point. Timing has never been a problem for him.
full on off stump, pushed to mid-off. Fourteen off the over then
ripper! Hits a lovely length, because the batsman doesnt know whether to come forward or back. Caught in the crease, he leads with his hands and the ball zips away past his outside edge
that time its a little fuller and Azhar presents a lovely drive through the covers. Hit on the up, but carefully controlled
neednt have bothered running. It was a pretty good ball - full on off stump - but Azhar leans into a solid front foot drive past mid-on. Great shot
edged, but there was only one slip in place. Lures Azhar to play forward, and away from the body, so the control isnt as good. Lakmals length is quite pleasing at the moment. Just not lucky enough
back of a length and outside off, pushed to mid-on
that was a little short and Azhar flicks it straight to midwicket. Could have done more there
shortish and outside off, punched to mid-on
standing outside his crease, the ball is full and almost on off stump, whipped to mid-on
uses the closed face again as this is a fuller ball on off stump and ends up at mid-on
stands back and punches a short ball straight to point. Dilshan is prowling there
a forceful punch to a good length ball on off stump. Finds mid-on again. Tends to struggle picking gaps early, Shehzad
fuller delivery on off stump, clipped to the left of short midwicket. Siriwardena is the man diving away, but he cant collect it cleanly enough to stop the single

belted down the ground! Lovely strike. Sri Lanka were looking to get some control back, but Shezhad says nah-uh. Dances down the track, gets to the pitch and lifts him against the turn and over mid-on. Clever batting
stays inside the line and looking for a few runs through the covers. Doesnt get the expected turn and gets an inside edge
gets down the track and drive into the covers
hes picking his gaps, by hitting over the fielders. To each his own. Sees the width, leans forward and lofts it over cover. Dilshan puts in a good, hard chase to stop that from reaching the boundary
uses his feet, does the Pakistan captain, and drives calmly to long-off
beaten in flight. Shehzhad charged down, and outside off. Pathirana slows it down and pulls his length back to fetch the inside edge. Single to deep midwicket
good start. Hits a full length on off stump and gets a drive to mid-off in response
sways his torso back and flashes at a short ball outside off, slashed to deep third man
back of a length on leg stump, nudged away to long leg
full on off stump, pushed down the ground. Manages to get it past the bowler, but not past mid-off

sliced through point. Theres the fifty. But the more eye-catching bit was the fielders tumbling over each other on the boundary. Both point and third man were chasing after it, seems no one had properly called it. All is fine though
pushed down to mid-on
tossed up on middle, defended

through the legs! Thats abysmal from Lakmal. Ran to his left, gets down to the drive. By all accounts this should have just been a single. But the ball just skips away past his hands and between his legs
looped in just outside off, goes for a big drive. But he doesnt get the spin he wanted. Inside edge
jumps down the track, takes the ball on the full and whips it away through midwicket
fuller delivery outside off, sliced away through the covers. Shehzad stays inside the line to ensure the off side is open to him
thats better. Thats what Sri Lanka want. Kusal leaps away to his left and controls a cut shot. Saves a boundary there. Poor work from the bowler though, short and wide
fuller delivery outside off, driven past short cover and just wide enough of mid-off to get a single
nudged past short midwicket. Just sliding down leg to start from the bowler
good length ball on off stump, defended

down the track to push a good length ball back at the bowler. Mathews moves to his left, grabs it and flicks a throw back. Hits the stumps direct and goes up for appeal. But the third umpire will rule not out because this is quite safe
full on off stump, pushes to mid-on
129kph, back of a length on off stump, carefully defended
inside edge digs into the hard pitch and leaps over the keeper. Goes for the cut, a bit too early with Malinga being a little low on pace. Finds a couple right behind him
129 kph, shortish and outside off, defended with the open face
gets across to the back of a length ball and punches it into the covers
picks out cover again as Malinga bowls a shortish length an inch or so outside off
cover again, this time he has to move to his right and pull off a dive. Five dot balls in the over. Much better from Sri Lanka
walks across on middle stump, would have been plumb had he not got the flick going. Single to long leg
full and wide outside off, driven to point who doesnt collect it cleanly on the first try. Priyanjan was the man diving to his left. But he makes a quick recovery
banged in short, a bit too short. Azhar ducks under it and collects the extra run
banged in short, at his pace Azhar can camp back and pull well in front of square. Pulled down too
fullish and outside off, run down to third man
gets down the track, Mathews decides to beat him by sneaking the length ball down leg. Azhar leaves and gets another wide
back of a length and outside off, sliced to deep third man
shortish and outside off, defended

down the throat of deep third man! Stepped down the track and goes for a wild slash outside off. Gets a thick outside edge that soars into the night sky and settles in the hands of Senanayake, the sub, I think. Azhar is furious with himself, thumps his pads with his bat
beaten outside off as Malinga gets the awayswinger going. Teasing fuller length to take advantage of Hafeez being new at the crease. No footwork, Both men wear big smiles Things are happening again
defends a shortish ball just outside off to point. Malinga is cranking his pace up as well. 135 kph
good length ball cuts away after pitching, Hafeez this time leaves outside off
good length and just outside off, trying to tempt Hafeez into playing a loose drive. He doesnt

excellent shot! Saw the width on offer and this time his front foot is eager. Gets across and Hafeez is in a better position as a result. Taps the ball on top of the bounce and it just screams away through point
slower, but shorter outside off, glided down to third man
full on fourth stump, defended
132kph, dug in short, and its pacy as well. Hafeez is happy to let that through outside off
back of a length and just outside off, defended

wants the quick single, and he gets it. The inside edge works in Hafeez favour. Wanted a drive, then checked his shot, nudges it past the bowlers right and sets off early. But mid-on was rather close too. Disappointing result for the fielding side
bowls the bouncer again on middle, left alone
shortish on middle and off, Hafeez uses his wrists to clip the ball through midwicket
full on middle, Shezhad nudges it softly through square leg and picks up a couple
stays back in his crease to block an back of a length awayswinger

outside edge, soars to the right of the keeper. No slip in place. Throws his hands at a wide delivery - a loose shot. Sri Lanka could have capitalised on that. Mathews just puts his head in his hands, while screaming inside probably

dropped by Thirimanne at that first slip position. Terrible work there. The false shot came out as Shehzad chased after the width. Healthy nick travels quickly to the fielder, who sticks his hands up over his right shoulder and makes a mess of it. That is also Shehzads fifty.
good length ball swinging away, left quite well alone
back of a length on off stump, defended
full on off stump, tapped to mid-on
fuller delivery slipping down the leg side. Flick and a miss from the batsman, but Sri Lanka are spraying this ball all over the place
shortish and just outside off, blocked
goes on the bounce to the long leg fielder as Hafeez rocks back to pull a short ball away
another good bouncer on middle, Hafeez this time ducks under it
another short ball on middle, he pulls in front of square leg and picks up an easy couple of runs. That will be drinks, by the way
bowls full, bowls straight, hit to mid-on
back of a length and just outside off, blocked
good length ball outside off, left quite well alone
looks to take a back of a length ball from outside off towards the on side. Gets a bit of a leading edge and the ball finds its way back to Malinga
good length ball outside off, run to point
back of a length and outside off, tapped into the covers
fullish and just outside off, pushed to point
knocked to mid-on with soft hands, and Pradeep who has returned to the field, is still is sluggish
banged in short, Hafeez drops his wrist and sways away as the ball passes over his right shoulder
back of a length and just outside off, punched to mid-off
fuller and slower ball, patted a bit uppishly to mid-on. Been accumulating a few dot balls, Hafeez
whipped away, but only as far as short midwicket. Tighter line on off stump from the bowlers is working
back of a length on off stump, defended in front of point. No chances for a single with Dilshan racing in so fast that his shoe fell away
shortish and outside off, drilled into the covers
good length ball on off stump, defended
thumped into the covers, but he still cant get the gap
offcutter just outside off, driven to mid-off
stands up tall behind a shortish delivery outside off and picks out cover
back of a length and outside off, Shehzad looks to force it through the off side. Ends up with an inside edge. Wants a single though, this could get dicey. But the fielder cant throw it in time
excellent timing from Hafeez as he gets back and across for a late cut. Malinga is the man at deep third man, has to race to his right and pull off a full length dive. The crowd appreciates that
straying on the pads with a short ball, Hafeez picks it away to long leg
nudged into the covers and they pinch a single. Was opened up by a back of a length delivery straightening on him. But he plays with soft hands
crisply hit! Overpitched, wide as well. Hafeez leans into an absolutely gorgeous drive through the covers
shortish on off stump, worked away to deep midwicket
floats up a fuller ball outside off, driven into the covers
picked away off his pads to deep midwicket
great work from the 38-year old Dilshan! Short ball, drilled to the left of point. But Dilshan throws himself in the direction of the ball and saves a boundary
good length ball, punched back at the bowler

whipped away through midwicket. Wasnt too far away from a Malinga special-delivered yorker. A clear example of how difficult that ball is. Shehzad is deep in his crease and lets his bottom hand take over

just wide of short midwicket! This was length, this was taken from well outside off, but the timing is incredibly. A whirl of the wrists like Dhonis helicopter takes the ball past the full-length dive of short midwicket to his left
finishes the over with a slower ball on off stump, defended. Malinga has bowled six overs on the trot now
length ball outside off, tapped through to the sweeper
flighted on middle, defended
gets down the track, but Pathirana shortens his length and gives away only a single to mid-on
stays back to a fuller ball and is squared up as he defends in front of off stump
cuts from off stump, but he cant find the gap at point
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off
tossed up on middle, defended
gets down the track and drives to cover
drags the ball short and Hafeez jumps back in his crease and nails a pull over midwicket
flighted just outside off to bring the batsman forward with a block
nips down the track and to the pitch for a fluent drive to long-off
flighted on middle, driven back at the bowler
hammered over extra cover. Emphatic way to bring up the fifty partnerhip. The are taking Sri Lanka apart again
lovely response! Pulls his length back, but not so much that Hafeez can stay back in his crease. Reaches for it, follows the turn and is lucky not to edge
goes back to block a good length ball on off stump
stays back and slices a shortish delivery to point
jumps down the track and shovels a good length ball up and over mid-on. Pathirana has been lined up today
tossed up just outside off, gets down the track and defends
good length ball rips right across the width of the batsman and settles into the keepers gloves
another short ball allows the batsman all the time he needs to pick the gap. Decides to bisect deep midwicket and long-on
flatter and quicker on off stump, swept away to deep midwicket
eases down the track and drives to mid-off
tossed up, goes for the sweep again, this time he hits it fine for a single to long leg
length ball, gets under it and powers it away to deep square leg boundary. Powerful sweep shot again. Spin has been dealt with quite mercilessly
goes back and whips a flat delivery through to deep midwicket
set up for a cut, but then the ball grips and comes at him quite slowly. The cut shot loops in the air but falls short of point
flighted outside off, defended
looks for a quick single, but Dilshan is the wrong man. Flighted just outside off, blocked with soft hands
deftly eased down the ground to long-off
tossed up on middle, pushed to mid-on
stays back and blocks a good length ball into the covers
goes around the wicket and slides a good length ball way down leg. Goes for a sweep, doesnt connect. Sri Lanka appeal to distract the umpire from calling a wide. No suck luck
pulls his length back as he sees the batsman jumping down the track. Grips in the pitch and turns to strike him on the pads
good length ball just outside off, defended. Hes getting some turn here
fired in, so no turn. stays low as well. Hafeez goes for a flick and connects only with pad
down the track for a little flick through midwicket
stays back and works the good length ball to short fine leg
swept on length, but he cant beat short fine leg
flighted outside off, driven smartly through the covers
hurtles down the track and hammers a flighted delivery down to long-off
flighted in on off stump, tapped through to long-off again. They hit the spinners heartily early on, now the gaps are more readily available. All they need to do is pick them
too short, too easy. Powered away through midwcket. Good use of the crease, as he went back close to his stumps to get the leverage he wanted
takes it from off stump, beats the point fielder. Malinga could have done better there. Very close to cut, but Shehazad has been around enough to connect well. Offside sweeper comes in handy
good length ball just outside off, defended
beautiful! They were trying to tuck him up by bowling around the wicket and onto his pads. But Shehzad gets down low and sweeps strongly to the square leg boundary.
gets inside the line of a tossed up ball on middle and drives to short cover
stays back for a good length ball and clips it to deep square leg
watches the length ball carefully, lets it come on towards off stump and pushes it through to deep cover
lunges down the track and once he is to the pitch of the offspinner, smears it wide of long-off. Calculative cricket, and the execution is spot on
pressure tells on Dilshan. Thinks Shehzad would jump down the track again so he bowls flat and down leg
driven to long-on to retain strike
flighted in on off stump, shoveled away to short cover
flighted on off stump, Shehzad jumps out of his crease and whips to mid-on
down the track again, and this time he is able to secure a single to mid-on
advances on the bowler - thats because Pathirana has not turned the ball much - driven sweetly to long-off
shortish and outside off, sliced to the right of point for a single
oh, this is just too easy for Pakistan. Hafeez flows down the track and lofts a length ball over the sightscreen. Marvellous batting
shortish on off stump, looks to block and run into the covers. Siriwardena isnt too accommodating
width on offer and he gently glides it behind point
banged in short and outside off, Hafeez sways away from the line
Dilshan puts in the dive to his right and stops a sweetly timed punch at point
short and rising outside off, Hafeez goes for a slash over third man. Doesnt connect
slower ball wanders down the leg side. Hafeez was looking to tickle it around the corner, doesnt connect
fullish on off stump, nudged to mid-on who is inside the circle. Seems like they dont even have to pick gaps now. Thats Hafeez fifty as well
full toss to start, whipped wide of long-on
down the track, but gets too close to the flighted delivery on off stump. Pushes it back to the bowler
flatter delivery forces the batsman back. Hafeez had made room to cut as well, and connects just enough to find point. had he missed that, middle pole out
shortish and on middle, pulled to deep square leg
flighted on off stump, pushed back at the bowler again
stays back to block a good length ball on off stump
shortish and outside off, glided to deep third man

oooh, he fall short of his century! Its back of a length and outside off, Shehzad gets under the ball and looks to ramp the ball to the third man boundary. But that age-old problem he has about not picking gaps haunts him. Made pretty good connection as usual, which is why it travelled that far. But Kusal Perera runs in, dives forward and takes a stinger. Is that the twist you wanted?
back of a length on off stump, carefully defended
gets inside the line of a short delivery on the pads, clipped to long leg for a couple. Good hustle
goes for a bouncer on middle and leg, Sarfraz sinks under it
another bouncer over middle, Sarfraz wants nothing of it
very full delivery angled into the pads, Hafeez goes for a sweep. A touch too full for that stroke, which is why he mistimes it
flighted on off stump, defended
pushed through rapdily on middle and off, gets an inside edge onto pad
leans into a fuller delivery outside off and knocks it down to long-on
flighted outside off, driven with the open face towards point
lunges forward to sweep, but the ball is not as full and a bit too slow. He has to reach out for it and as a result connects poorly
pulled from outside off and the ball skips off to the midwicket boundary. Bouncer from Lakmal, but it doesn;t have any sting
offcutter just outside off, Hafeez is forward with a little slide to deep third man. Two he wants and two he gets
into the pull again, but he is a bit too early on the ball. Gets a toe end to the short delivery and it wanders down to mid-on
quicker short ball this time, Hafeez is late on the pull this time. Gets it high on the bat and it goes away towards fine leg
goes short again, Sarfraz pulls and keeps it down to short midwicket
bouncer to finish, or not because this has sailed a bit too far over the ducking batsmans head
back of a length on off stump, pushed to mid-on
tossed up on off stump, defended
stays back to a flatter ball just outside off and goes for a cut. But ends up with an inside edge that could easily have hit the off stump
pushed through outside off, tapped into the covers
tries to back away and open up the off side, cant find the gap because the flatter ball follows him
eases down the track to a flighted delivery outside off and drives through to deep cover
flighted on off stump, driven to long-off
good work by Kusal on the third man boundary. Races to his left, dives and stops a boundary. Sarfraz had connected so neatly with the late cut too
another deft little dab to go through to deep third man
stays back and blocks a good length ball and blocks

he has been trying hard to attack the batsman with the one dug in. But this simply sits up. Hafeez sees it all the way onto his bat, takes it well in front of him and pulls to the long leg boundary. Got good bounce, but no real pace. But off the bat, it just flew
back of a length and outside off, looks to run it down to third man. Gets an inside edge
the slower ball is short again and Hafeez nails a pull to deep square leg

one, two, third time lucky for Chandimal and Siriwardena. He sucked Hafeez down the track with a little flight, got the ball to pitch before the batsmen reached it, shaved the outside edge. Then the keeper lunges for it with hard hands. Pops out, pops out again and slip was looking to offer support. But Chandimal maintained calm and pouched it on the third try
stays back to a good length ball and punches it to cover. Could easily have hit the stumps had he not been as alert
stays back to a good length ball that stays low too. Good work from Malik

catch it, they yell. But the flick from Malik lobs the mid-on fielder. Couple of runs easy, but the throw that comes in well wide of the bowler, Siriwardena runs after it and looks to break the stumps at the bowlers end only to end up offering an overthrow
pushed through into the batsmans pads. Hits him on the thigh and was sliding down, so no use with the appeal
flighted just outside off, defended
flighted in on off stump, defended
works it past the short midwicket fielder for a simple single to mid-on
stays back to cut a length ball on off stump to point
leading edge, but mid-off is on the boundary. Pretty thick leading edge as Sarfraz races down the track to flick through the leg side. Short cover does his best to follow it, but it clears him easily
races down the track and hammers a flighted ball over the long-off fielder. Not by much, but he gets it over Thirimanne
flighted in on off stump, defended
flighted in on middle, Sarfraz defends
stays inside the line of a flighted delivery on off stump and drives through the covers for a single
how did that miss the off stump! Nowhere near short enough to pull, but Malik goes for it. The ball ducks under the bat, sneaks through the keepers legs as well. That was phenomenally lucky
down the track to a fuller delivery on off stump, defended
down the track and wears it on the front pad. Flatter and quicker that time, an arm ball perhaps? Weathers an lbw appeal

pulls and he played it so hard he nearly overbalanced. Only a shade short again, but Malik had camped so deep in his crease, expecting that change in length after he had charged the last few balls. Then sends it soaring over midwicket
eases down the pitch and clips the ball away through midwicket. How well did he time that. Not particularly to the pitch, but his wristwork makes up for that
gets the mistake out of the bowler as this becomes short and wide, cut away through cover
stays back to a good length ball and clips it through midwicket
gets under the ball on leg stump and launches it over long-on. That was brutal again as he waded down the track and unleashed a full swing of the arms

dropped by short midwicket. Kusal was the man there, who fails to convert the opportunity. Malik was down the track again, but the bowler has pushed it outside off and pulled his length back. That meant the batsman had to drag it and he mistimes it
fired in on the pads, kept out
leans into a solid drive through to long-off
jumps down to drill a flighted delivery to mid-on. Got too close to it
shortish and a shade outside off, run to point
short again and Malik has launched it over midwicket. Pakistan have sealed it! First series win in nine years in Sri Lanka.
